main event: A ground radar system in Salt Lake City, Utah detected two green lights for 3 seconds on December 6, 1954. A single green light was also observed visually for 6 seconds. The object was described as traveling at high speed, about 10,000 yards away.
interesting points: The object was reported to have a sound similar to a locomotive.
The object appeared to travel about 1/2 mile in 3 seconds before disappearing.
A bright object was observed visually simultaneously with the radar detection.
The sighting was reported by the military and a university.
The military's assessment was that the sighting was possibly a balloon, aircraft, or astronomical in nature, but there was insufficient data to make a definitive evaluation.
sighted object: two green lights on radar, one green light observed visually
